FuncDef:
The rip bfd command sets BFD session parameters on the specified interface.
The undo rip bfd command restores default BFD session parameters.
The rip bfd enable command enables BFD on the specified interface to establish a BFD session with default parameters.
The undo rip bfd enable command disables BFD on the specified interface. The rip bfd command sets BFD session parameters on the specified interface. The undo rip bfd command restores default BFD session parameters. The rip bfd enable command enables BFD on the specified interface to establish a BFD session with default parameters. The undo rip bfd enable command disables BFD on the specified interface. By default, BFD session parameters use the default values.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the minimum interval at which BFD packets are sent to the remote device.
The value is an integer ranging from 3 to 1000. The default value is 10.

Specifies the minimum interval for receiving BFD messages from the peer.
The value is an integer ranging from 3 to 1000. The default value is 10.

Specifies the local detect multiplier.
The value is an integer ranging from 3 to 50. The default value is 3.
